verses.kjv: Now in the eighteenth year of king Jeroboam the son of Nebat reigned Abijam over Judah.
verses.web: Now in the eighteenth year of king Jeroboam the son of Nebat, Abijam began to reign over Judah.
verses.ct: In the 18th year of King Jeroboam son of Nebat, Abijam became king of Judah.

verses.kjv: Three years reigned he in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Maachah, the daughter of Abishalom.
verses.web: He reigned three years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Maacah the daughter of Abishalom.
verses.ct: He ruled in Jerusalem for 3 years. His mother's name was Maachah, the daughter of Abishalom.

verses.kjv: And he walked in all the sins of his father, which he had done before him: and his heart was not perfect with the LORD his God, as the heart of David his father.
verses.web: He walked in all the sins of his father, which he had done before him; and his heart was not perfect with LORD his God, as the heart of David his father.
verses.ct: He committed all the same sins his father had before him. His heart was not fully devoted to the LORD his God the way David's heart had been.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless for David’s sake did the LORD his God give him a lamp in Jerusalem, to set up his son after him, and to establish Jerusalem:
verses.web: Nevertheless for David’s sake, LORD his God gave him a lamp in Jerusalem, to set up his son after him, and to establish Jerusalem;
verses.ct: Even so, for David's sake the LORD his God kept a lamp burning in Jerusalem by raising up a son to succeed him and by keeping Jerusalem secure.

verses.kjv: Because David did that which was right in the eyes of the LORD, and turned not aside from any thing that he commanded him all the days of his life, save only in the matter of Uriah the Hittite.
verses.web: because David did that which was right in LORD’s eyes, and didn’t turn away from anything that he commanded him all the days of his life, except only in the matter of Uriah the Hittite.
verses.ct: This was because David had done what was right in the LORD's eyes and never strayed from anything God commanded him throughout his entire life — except in the matter of Uriah the Hittite.

verses.kjv: And there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam all the days of his life.
verses.web: Now there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam all the days of his life.
verses.ct: There was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam throughout Abijam's life.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Abijam, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah? And there was war between Abijam and Jeroboam.
verses.web: The rest of the acts of Abijam, and all that he did, aren’t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah? There was war between Abijam and Jeroboam.
verses.ct: Everything else about Abijam's reign and all he did is recorded in the official history of Judah's kings. There was also war between Abijam and Jeroboam.

verses.kjv: And Abijam slept with his fathers; and they buried him in the city of David: and Asa his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: Abijam slept with his fathers, and they buried him in David’s city; and Asa his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Abijam died and was buried in the city of David. His son Asa became king after him.

verses.kjv: And in the twentieth year of Jeroboam king of Israel reigned Asa over Judah.
verses.web: In the twentieth year of Jeroboam king of Israel, Asa began to reign over Judah.
verses.ct: In the 20th year of King Jeroboam of Israel, Asa became king of Judah.

verses.kjv: And forty and one years reigned he in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Maachah, the daughter of Abishalom.
verses.web: He reigned forty-one years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Maacah the daughter of Abishalom.
verses.ct: He ruled in Jerusalem for 41 years. His mother's name was Maachah, the daughter of Abishalom.

verses.kjv: And Asa did that which was right in the eyes of the LORD, as did David his father.
verses.web: Asa did that which was right in LORD’s eyes, as David his father did.
verses.ct: Asa did what was right in the LORD's eyes, just as his ancestor David had done.

verses.kjv: And he took away the sodomites out of the land, and removed all the idols that his fathers had made.
verses.web: He put away the sodomites out of the land, and removed all the idols that his fathers had made.
verses.ct: He expelled the male shrine prostitutes from the land and got rid of all the idols his ancestors had made.

verses.kjv: And also Maachah his mother, even her he removed from being queen, because she had made an idol in a grove; and Asa destroyed her idol, and burnt it by the brook Kidron.
verses.web: He also removed Maacah his mother from being queen, because she had made an abominable image for an Asherah. Asa cut down her image and burned it at the brook Kidron.
verses.ct: He even removed his mother Maachah from her position as queen mother because she had made a disgusting idol for an Asherah pole. Asa cut down her idol and burned it at the brook Kidron.

verses.kjv: But the high places were not removed: nevertheless Asa’s heart was perfect with the LORD all his days.
verses.web: But the high places were not taken away. Nevertheless the heart of Asa was perfect with LORD all his days.
verses.ct: The high places were not removed, but Asa's heart was fully devoted to the LORD throughout his life.

verses.kjv: And he brought in the things which his father had dedicated, and the things which himself had dedicated, into the house of the LORD, silver, and gold, and vessels.
verses.web: He brought into LORD’s house the things that his father had dedicated, and the things that he himself had dedicated: silver, gold, and utensils.
verses.ct: He brought into the house of the LORD all the items his father had dedicated, along with his own dedicated offerings — silver, gold, and various vessels.

verses.kjv: And there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.
verses.web: There was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.
verses.ct: There was constant war between Asa and King Baasha of Israel throughout their reigns.

verses.kjv: And Baasha king of Israel went up against Judah, and built Ramah, that he might not suffer any to go out or come in to Asa king of Judah.
verses.web: Baasha king of Israel went up against Judah, and built Ramah, that he might not allow anyone to go out or come in to Asa king of Judah.
verses.ct: King Baasha of Israel marched against Judah and fortified Ramah to block anyone from entering or leaving King Asa's territory.

verses.kjv: Then Asa took all the silver and the gold that were left in the treasures of the house of the LORD, and the treasures of the king’s house, and delivered them into the hand of his servants: and king Asa sent them to Benhadad, the son of Tabrimon, the son of Hezion, king of Syria, that dwelt at Damascus, saying,
verses.web: Then Asa took all the silver and the gold that was left in the treasures of LORD’s house, and the treasures of the king’s house, and delivered it into the hand of his servants. Then King Asa sent them to Ben Hadad, the son of Tabrimmon, the son of Hezion, king of Syria, who lived at Damascus, saying,
verses.ct: So Asa gathered all the silver and gold remaining in the treasuries of the LORD's house and the royal palace, handed it to his servants, and sent them to Ben-hadad son of Tabrimon, son of Hezion, king of Syria, who lived in Damascus. His message said,

verses.kjv: There is a league between me and thee, and between my father and thy father: behold, I have sent unto thee a present of silver and gold; come and break thy league with Baasha king of Israel, that he may depart from me.
verses.web: “There is a treaty between me and you, between my father and your father. Behold, I have sent to you a present of silver and gold. Go, break your treaty with Baasha king of Israel, that he may depart from me.”
verses.ct: "There is a treaty between us, just as there was between our fathers. Look — I'm sending you a gift of silver and gold. Break your treaty with King Baasha of Israel so he will pull back from me."

verses.kjv: So Benhadad hearkened unto king Asa, and sent the captains of the hosts which he had against the cities of Israel, and smote Ijon, and Dan, and Abelbethmaachah, and all Cinneroth, with all the land of Naphtali.
verses.web: Ben Hadad listened to king Asa, and sent the captains of his armies against the cities of Israel, and struck Ijon, and Dan, and Abel Beth Maacah, and all Chinneroth, with all the land of Naphtali.
verses.ct: Ben-hadad agreed and sent his army commanders against the cities of Israel. They attacked Ijon, Dan, Abel-beth-maachah, and all of Cinneroth, along with the entire region of Naphtali.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Baasha heard thereof, that he left off building of Ramah, and dwelt in Tirzah.
verses.web: When Baasha heard of it, he stopped building Ramah, and lived in Tirzah.
verses.ct: When Baasha heard about this, he abandoned the construction at Ramah and withdrew to Tirzah.

verses.kjv: Then king Asa made a proclamation throughout all Judah; none was exempted: and they took away the stones of Ramah, and the timber thereof, wherewith Baasha had builded; and king Asa built with them Geba of Benjamin, and Mizpah.
verses.web: Then king Asa made a proclamation to all Judah. No one was exempted. They carried away the stones of Ramah, and its timber, with which Baasha had built; and king Asa used it to build Geba of Benjamin, and Mizpah.
verses.ct: Then King Asa issued a proclamation to all of Judah — no one was exempt. They hauled away the stones and timber Baasha had been using to build Ramah, and King Asa used those materials to fortify Geba of Benjamin and Mizpah.

verses.kjv: The rest of all the acts of Asa, and all his might, and all that he did, and the cities which he built, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah? Nevertheless in the time of his old age he was diseased in his feet.
verses.web: Now the rest of all the acts of Asa, and all his might, and all that he did, and the cities which he built, aren’t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah? But in the time of his old age he was diseased in his feet.
verses.ct: Everything else about Asa — all his achievements, his power, everything he did, and the cities he built — is recorded in the official history of Judah's kings. In his old age, however, he developed a disease in his feet.

verses.kjv: And Asa slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David his father: and Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: Asa slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in his father David’s city; and Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Asa died and was buried with his ancestors in the city of his ancestor David. His son Jehoshaphat became king after him.

verses.kjv: And Nadab the son of Jeroboam began to reign over Israel in the second year of Asa king of Judah, and reigned over Israel two years.
verses.web: Nadab the son of Jeroboam began to reign over Israel in the second year of Asa king of Judah; and he reigned over Israel two years.
verses.ct: Nadab son of Jeroboam became king of Israel in the 2nd year of King Asa of Judah. He ruled Israel for 2 years.

verses.kjv: And he did evil in the sight of the LORD, and walked in the way of his father, and in his sin wherewith he made Israel to sin.
verses.web: He did that which was evil in LORD’s sight, and walked in the way of his father, and in his sin with which he made Israel to sin.
verses.ct: He did evil in the LORD's sight, following the same path as his father and continuing the sin that Jeroboam had led Israel into.

verses.kjv: And Baasha the son of Ahijah, of the house of Issachar, conspired against him; and Baasha smote him at Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines; for Nadab and all Israel laid siege to Gibbethon.
verses.web: Baasha the son of Ahijah, of the house of Issachar, conspired against him; and Baasha struck him at Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines; for Nadab and all Israel were besieging Gibbethon.
verses.ct: Baasha son of Ahijah, from the tribe of Issachar, plotted against him. Baasha struck him down at Gibbethon, a Philistine town, while Nadab and all Israel were besieging it.

verses.kjv: Even in the third year of Asa king of Judah did Baasha slay him, and reigned in his stead.
verses.web: Even in the third year of Asa king of Judah, Baasha killed him, and reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Baasha killed him in the 3rd year of King Asa of Judah and took the throne.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when he reigned, that he smote all the house of Jeroboam; he left not to Jeroboam any that breathed, until he had destroyed him, according unto the saying of the LORD, which he spake by his servant Ahijah the Shilonite:
verses.web: As soon as he was king, he struck all the house of Jeroboam. He didn’t leave to Jeroboam any who breathed, until he had destroyed him; according to the saying of LORD, which he spoke by his servant Ahijah the Shilonite;
verses.ct: As soon as Baasha became king, he wiped out Jeroboam's entire family. He didn't leave a single person alive — he destroyed them all. This fulfilled the word the LORD had spoken through his servant Ahijah the Shilonite.

verses.kjv: Because of the sins of Jeroboam which he sinned, and which he made Israel sin, by his provocation wherewith he provoked the LORD God of Israel to anger.
verses.web: for the sins of Jeroboam which he sinned, and with which he made Israel to sin, because of his provocation with which he provoked LORD, the God of Israel, to anger.
verses.ct: This happened because of the sins Jeroboam had committed and caused Israel to commit, provoking the LORD, the God of Israel, to anger.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Nadab, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Nadab, and all that he did, aren’t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.ct: Everything else about Nadab's reign and all he did is recorded in the official history of Israel's kings.

verses.kjv: And there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.
verses.web: There was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.
verses.ct: There was constant war between Asa and King Baasha of Israel throughout their reigns.

verses.kjv: In the third year of Asa king of Judah began Baasha the son of Ahijah to reign over all Israel in Tirzah, twenty and four years.
verses.web: In the third year of Asa king of Judah, Baasha the son of Ahijah began to reign over all Israel in Tirzah for twenty-four years.
verses.ct: In the 3rd year of King Asa of Judah, Baasha son of Ahijah became king over all Israel in Tirzah. He ruled for 24 years.

verses.kjv: And he did evil in the sight of the LORD, and walked in the way of Jeroboam, and in his sin wherewith he made Israel to sin.
verses.web: He did that which was evil in LORD’s sight, and walked in the way of Jeroboam, and in his sin with which he made Israel to sin.
verses.ct: He did evil in the LORD's sight, following the same path as Jeroboam and continuing the sin that Jeroboam had led Israel into.
